features: Intel LGA 1700 Socket: Supports 13th and next-gen processors

body.description: Intel LGA 1700 Socket: Supports 13th and next-gen processorsDual Channel DDR5: 4*DIMMs with XMP 3.0 memory module supportCommanding Power Design: Twin 18+1+2 Phases Digital VRM SolutionCutting-Edge Thermal Design: VRM Thermal Armor Advanced & M.2 Thermal GuardUltra-Fast Storage: 5*M.2 slots, including 1* PCIe 5.0 x4Fast Networks: 5GbE LAN & Wi-Fi 7Extended Connectivity: PCIe 5.0, DP, HDMI, Front & Rear USB-C 20Gb/sFine Tuning Features: RGB FUSION 2.0, Supports Addressable LED & RGB LED Strips, Smart Fan 6, Q-Flash Plus Update BIOS without installing CPU, Memory, and GPU. Introducing AORUS Z790 X Motherboards, the most powerful platform, built for the next generation of Intel Core processors. With leading performance in DDR5 memory, upgraded DIY innovation, and an all-new BIOS, AORUS Z790 X Motherboards are built to unleash next-gen power.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.6 3.6 out of 5 stars 26 ratings 3.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Your only white MB option
reviews.reviewText: This is a solid board for the price! I had been looking at this board for about a month, seeing the reviews roll in and becoming rather skeptical.I had no issues getting everything installed, it has all the RGB connection that you could ever wish for. It did the usual 3-4 initial boots during the first boot and windows 11 installed without a hiccup. Same goes for the firmware update.My only hiccup was adding my graphics card which did not display anything, long story short, my card will only work with the power adapter that came with the card. I used the one that came with my PSU, which resulted int he card not being detected. I assume that this is the reason others had issues as well.Very happy with the result.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: POR SER ALGO DE ULTIMA GENERACION MUY PESIMOno viene con un-DVD o USB para los drivers el puerto de video DP no funciona no me levanto el monitor LG 27MD5KL que es Conexion tipo cviene con una R v1.0 cuando no es 1.2 o sea la revision que me mandaron es antiguael rgb de la placa base pésimo y pobreel comando center muy pobre y con muy pocas acciones y aplicaciones para configurarel precio debería ser GRATIS por ender va de vuelta a su vendedor

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice quality!!
reviews.reviewText: I was concerned about buying this motherboard after seen the reviews but I specs look good to what I need so I bought it! Any so far had no issues at all. It posted from the first time and run some Cinebench23, 3D mark and seems perfectly stable. I am running i7 13700k with nzxt 280mm aio, Evga 3080ti, Corsair 6000 cl36 ram with xmp on and all the other settings stock. Just adjusted fan curves and updated the bios. In Cinebench23 for 10 minutes it gave me a score of 29845 multi core with temperatures no higher then 83 which I am very happy with it but I will try to OC it to see if I can get 30k score. 230watts max I saw without me undervolting or changing any setting in bios. Love the board so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely amazing. This motherboard is way more capable than anything I ever needed, but it was the only white colored gigabyte motherboard compatible with 14th generation Intel chips. I have no doubt that this would be perfect for any high end user as well. It comes with a gen 7 wifi antenna as well which has somehow been faster than using an Ethernet cable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Wouldn’t boot up with NVME
reviews.reviewText: Looks wise it is the most incredible board i’ve laid my eyes on. I ordered a used version, cuz it was like 30 bucks cheaper i thought maybe that wasn’t the best idea but it was set in stone so i went w it. Got all built and then realized it didn’t recognize my M.2 drive, i couldn’t boot up, I put the ssd in all 4 slots would not recognize, tried my sata, wouldn’t recognize, used both on a different computer and worked. The bios is really confusing, I’m hoping i got a dud and that it isn’t like this for brand new boards, bc this board is as beautiful as they come. Dang gigabyte.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great ALL-WHITE Z790
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Thought I would chime in here since GIGABYTE boards seem to have fewer reviews and generally the GIGABYTE brand gets a bad rep.I built my PC with this board, and I am glad I did. I haven't had any issues with overclocking/undervolting or making any system adjustments in BIOS. The board came ready with the (2nd to most) recent BIOS that allowed my 14th gen i9 14900k to work as well, without needing any sort of update.One minor hiccup was with the WiFi and Bluetooth drivers. It's not really on them, kind of just on me - you need Windows 11 to use the Bluetooth and WiFi features, as the drivers are only available for Win11 setup. I can confirm that I tried to install them on Windows 10, and while it seemed to run the install file, it didn't work and ended up aborting the install. Ironically, upgrading to Windows 11 also seemed to improve my performance in games? I used to have a stuttering issue that is much less noticeable now. Either way, not on them, mostly on me. The only other issue is that the BIOS UI is a bit ugly and less intuitive than my experience with ASUS in the past, but it's navigable and once you look things up, not hard to manage.The motherboard is also gorgeous in person, the pictures do not do it justice. I built it in a b/w case, doing white parts on a black interior and white exterior. This looks perfect in my case, having the bare minimum black in its design and being a large white space in my case to help balance the colors. I think that the only other real option (that you can still buy, since ASUS won't restock those Z790s) is the NZXT white mobo. Otherwise, if you really want an all-white board, not one with white highlights, this is your option.The main reason I give this 4 instead of 5 stars is that, while I personally have only had a good experience with it, it's kind of overpriced. There is a very similar model as others have pointed out, and it's like $100 less, the BIGGEST feature being that this motherboard is white. I also wish it had more USB ports but I just use a million devices, so probably not applicable to most users. I'm personally fine with what I paid for it, but it's definitely not the most cost-to-feature effective mobo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Me dejó de funcionar!
reviews.reviewText: Desde un principio llegó en mal estado su caja, cuando instale todo siempre me dio problema la bios, se actualizó la bios por gygabyte control center y dejó de funcionar! Quiero devolver, pero he votado la caja y Amazn no me da una solucion
